4.30.24  7:39 am   Why aren't saxophones brass

Â Â Â Â Â  because they have to be in a different category from the trumpets etc, because the mouth technique has nothing in common. someone who can play one can't even play 1 note on the other. at all

4.29.24  10:23 pm   Opinions on the number 37?

Â Â Â Â Â  it's what you get when you divide 111 by three. i'm sure everyone will remember the time they tried to divide 111 by three, expecting it to break apart into three 1's. but instead it turns out to be 37

4.29.24  8:23 pm   Is it advisable to jump headfirst into music with no prior knowledge, or do I learn first, then make. I want to dive in, but I need a professional's opinion 

Â Â Â Â Â  you can't learn music without doing it. it's like ..... walking . you pretty much only learn while doing it

4.29.24  12:11 pm   you have said that instrumental music is usually in the service of something else (if you didn't say that im sorry). but my question is: say someone is creating an instrumental song that is meant to convey something like a feeling or state of mind, just with no lyrics. does that count as the purpose its serving? like, assuming no video content or any use in anything, just music as a canvas. is that enough?

Â Â Â Â Â  in this case, maybe the word 'canvas' is the anchor. maybe the artist person themself is the anchor. if there were truly no anchor, then you would have no memory of it because you didn't hear it at any time or place. any place or time or circumstance connected to you hearing the song, that will anchor the music for you

4.29.24  10:23 am   how can one become good at something but without the ability to be good at it, i wanna make music and draw but i can't

Â Â Â Â Â  just start doing it (bad, if you have to) and keep doing it.

Â Â Â Â Â  this may seem like a random answer, but, no i don't

4.29.24  3:35 am   How to get better at "playing outside" jazzwise?

Â Â Â Â Â  play as if your planning on hitting right notes soon. pick a point 4 bars out into the future, and act like you're sure you're gonna land on the 'right' notes then. but until that point comes, play literally any thing you want, knowing that you will end up landing in the right place in that future moment that you have your eye on. most importantly, you have to really know the song, as a song, so you can find when the important landing points should be

4.29.24  3:23 am   how to pronounce gif

4.28.24  11:49 am   i have this fascinating issue where maybe 9/10 times I hear some kind of lyrics or words in a song i fall down this tunnel of thinking about where they originated, how the artist felt, why they phrased it that way, how it must have come about in the writing stage, etc until it just becomes totally overwhelming and I can't listen anymore cause it hits the inside part very hard. maybe a case of "how is this even possible" itis. is there a cure for this y/n and if n how do I Deal with it

Â Â Â Â Â  i'm not sure why you'd wanna cure that
